p: The analysis of the relationship between the total weight and fork length ( Eq 1) using a total of 5,660 specimens showed that it was isometric: a = 0.02 ± 0.04, b = 3.00 ± 0.01 and r 2 = 0.93 ( Fig 2). For the hot season only (from June to October), S. maderensis exhibited negative allometry (a = 0.02 ± 0.07; b = 2.95 ± 0.02; R 2 = 0.89 and n = 2043) and for the cold season (November to May), growth showed also slightly negative allometry (a = 0.02 ± 0.04; b = 2.98 ± 0.01; R 2 = 0.94 and n = 3617).
